medical_history.chief_complaint: Mid-epigastric abdominal pain described as dull, aching sensation.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The abdominal pain developed initially and persisted for 4 hours with no similar pain in the past. It was associated with nausea and non-bilious, non-bloody vomiting once. The patient was febrile to 101.7, with tenderness noted in the left upper quadrant (LUQ) and right upper quadrant (RUQ). Notably, the patient experienced left shoulder and arm burning pain 2 days prior to admission that resolved spontaneously.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, COPD, partial gastrectomy secondary to tumor 11 months ago, dyslipidemia, diabetes mellitus type II.
medical_history.family_history: Uncle and aunt died of pancreatic cancer; father had bladder cancer that resolved and subsequently died of lymphoma.
